com.complet

Class HtmlFiles

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.complet.HtmlFiles

  • public class HtmlFiles
extends java.lang.Object

    Create Files - HtmlFiles.java

    The HtmlFiles Class is responsible for the file system related to our Web Crawler.

    Note: Complet team suggests careful use of this class.

    Since:
    2017-01-02
    Version:
    6.0
    Author:
    Complet

    • Constructor Detail

      • HtmlFiles

        public HtmlFiles()

    • Method Detail

      • checkPath

        public static void checkPath(java.lang.String path)

        CheckPath is the first method of this class. Gets a path(String) as a parameter and firstly checks if the path exists.If it exists, it creates a new folder with the name "HTML_Files" and concatenates the path with Mainclass' path variables. If the path is not valid, then the user must enter again the path and checkpath method is called recursively.

        Parameters:
        path - The path that we want the HTML_Files directory to be created.

      • createFile

        public static void createFile(java.lang.String link,
                              java.lang.String path,
                              int index)
                       throws java.io.IOException
        CreateFile is the second method of this class. This method creates the files.

        File names have a specific structure. Name: index + ".html", example "0.html". This may seem inconvenient, but when combined with the Sql server URL list the search engine will be able to locate and retrieve the HTML code really easily.

        Parameters:
        link - This link's html code will be saved to the file created.
        path - This is the path that we want each file to be created (This path was checked with checkpath method).
        index - Index is an integer variable. Files created will be assigned with the URL list on the Sql server.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Input/Output Exception while creating the files

      • deleteDirectory

        public static boolean deleteDirectory(java.io.File directory)
        DeleteDirectory is the last method of this class. Checks if the file given exists. If so, recursively deletes every file in this directory.
        Parameters:
        directory -
        Returns:
        deleteDirectory(File) After deleting every file, the program returns the deletion of the Directory.
